title: Art Deco Typeface
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415193822im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cassandre_6120.png)

Anyone know what 'L'ATLANTQUE  
 is set in?

Cheers,
author: veclord

comments.content:
It looks like **Cassannet Bold** : by Atipo [2011]:  
 [http://cassannet.net/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415193822/http:/cassannet.net/ "http://cassannet.net/")  
 [http://thefonty.com/clouds/fonts/fonty/newfonts?sort=new&txt=L%27ATLANTI...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415193822/http:/thefonty.com/clouds/fonts/fonty/newfonts?sort=new&txt=L%27ATLANTIQUE&search=cassannet "http://thefonty.com/clouds/fonts/fonty/newfonts?sort=new&txt=L%27ATLANTIQUE&search=cassannet")
A.M. Cassandre designed the poster, and hand drew the type on it. The typeface is based on that hand-lettering.

Here at least two other typefaces directly inspired by Cassandre's poster lettering:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/68721](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415193822/http:/typophile.com/node/68721 "http://typophile.com/node/68721")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetanic-fonts/transat/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415193822/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetanic-fonts/transat/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetanic-fonts/transat/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/le-havre/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415193822/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/le-havre/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/le-havre/")
